page.title: 11LIFE AT HOLME FARM,CLAYPOLE
page.content: { I then asked my father about the work on Holme Farm. The busiest time of the year is summer and autumn. He harvests the crops and plants next year's seeds. During the winter he looks after the cattle in the sheds. Another winter job is repairing the machinery for next year's harvest. In the spring he turns out the cattle and applies chemicals and fertiliser to the growing crops. Lastly I asked him about the farm and how it has changed. He said it had changed a lot. The farm has less men, more machinery, more chemicals and fertiliser and bigger fields. This is because many of the hedges have been ripped out a current trend that is being reversed for ecological reasons.
